name: Beryllium chloride
desc: Beryllium chloride is an inorganic compound with the formula BeCl2. It is a colourless, hygroscopic solid that dissolves well in many polar solvents. Its properties are similar to those of aluminium chloride, due to beryllium's diagonal relationship with aluminium.
Solubility:
soluble in alcohol, ether, benzene, and pyridine
slightly soluble in chloroform and sulfur dioxide
PEL (Permissible):
TWA 0.002 mg/m3
C 0.005 mg/m3 (30 minutes), with a maximum peak of 0.025 mg/m3 (as Be)[1]
Other anions:
Beryllium fluoride
Beryllium bromide
Beryllium iodide
Other cations:
Magnesium chloride
Calcium chloride
Strontium chloride
Barium chloride
Radium chloride
